org.openntf.osgiworlds.model
Interface ViewWrapper

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractViewWrapper, KeyDateViewWrapper
public interface ViewWrapper

Author:
Paul Withers

A wrapper for a Domino View. Use serverName, databaseName and viewName to map to the relevant Domino view(s) - there's no specific reason for needing multiple ViewWrappers for different views. You can just reset whichever variables you need to and handle what data gets output, based on the current viewName.

By using searchString and category, this wrapper may only provide access to a sub-set of ViewEntries. If those are both blank, the wrapper will provide access to all ViewEntries int he underlying View. Otherwise you will not be able to navigate outside the sub-set of ViewEntries matching the searchString and category without modifying the criteria for this wrapper.

Start and count are used to manage which entries are displayed back to the user on the current request.

currentPage and availablePages are used for updating a pager.

getEntries() and getEntriesAsMap() methods are used to get relevant ViewEntryWrappers to display back to the user. The wrappers need to contain all the column values or computed values you want to display to the user.

calculateAvailablePages

void calculateAvailablePages(java.lang.Object coll)
Calculates the available pages and sets availablePages.

If at the end of the view, sets it to current page.

Maximum number of pages to check is 2 is currentPage > 3, otherwise 5 - currentPage. Links will only be shown to 5 pages, so beyond page 3, links will only be shown for 2 pages either side of currentPage.

Otherwise calls relevant getRemainingPages up to the maximum depending on whether the collection is a ViewEntryCollection or a ViewNavigator.

If currentPage > 3, sets pageCount to pageCount + currentPage. Otherwise, if pageCount < 5, sets pageCount to currentPage + pageCount.

Parameters:
coll -

getRemainingPages

int getRemainingPages(org.openntf.domino.ViewNavigator nav,
                      int maxCount)
Calculates the remaining pages after the current page based on a ViewNavigator. Where possible use this, because ViewNavigators are quicker and have a skip() method to skip count entries and return the number of available entries up to a defined maximum.

Parameters:
nav - ViewNavigator containing entries available in this viewWrapper
maxCount - maximum number of pages to look for, 5 or currentPage + 2, whichever ia higher
Returns:
int remaining pages

getRemainingPages

int getRemainingPages(org.openntf.domino.ViewEntryCollection ec,
                      int maxCount)
Calculates the remaining pages after the current page based on a ViewEntryCollection. Where possible use the ViewNavigator option, but sometimes that's not possible. This method needs to do a for loop to iterate through to see if there are count number of entries available for the relevant page

Parameters:
ec - ViewEntryCollection containing entries available in this viewWrapper
maxCount - maximum number of pages to look for, 5 or currentPage + 2, whichever ia higher
Returns:
int remaining pages

getCurrentPage

int getCurrentPage()
Gets the current page number being displayed

Returns:
int current page number

setCurrentPage

void setCurrentPage(int page)
Sets the current page number being displayed

Parameters:
page - int current page number
